metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2996 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the python-scciclient when making an HTTPS connection to a server where the server's certificate would not be verified. This issue opens up the connection to possible Man-in-the-middle (MITM) attacks.

criterions.comment: python-scciclient: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
